text: Seventy-ninth session
Agenda item 72 (b)
Strengthening of the coordination of humanitarian and disaster relief assistance of the United Nations, including special economic assistance: assistance to the Palestinian people
Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 9 December 2024
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/79/L.41)]
79/141.	Assistance to the Palestinian people
The General Assembly,
Recalling its resolutions 77/30 of 6 December 2022 and 78/121 of 8 December 2023, as well as its previous resolutions on the question,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolutions 77/30 of 6 December 2022 and 78/121 of 8 December 2023, as well as its previous resolutions on the question,

text: Recalling also the signing of the Declaration of Principles on Interim Self‑Government Arrangements in Washington, D.C., on 13 September 1993, by the Government of the State of Israel and the Palestine Liberation Organization, the representative of the Palestinian people, and the subsequent implementation agreements concluded by the two sides,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Government of the State of Israel

textWithHighlights: *Recalling also* the signing of the Declaration of Principles on Interim Self‑Government Arrangements in Washington, D.C., on 13 September 1993, by the {{Government of the State of Israel}} and the {{Palestine Liberation Organization}}, the representative of the Palestinian people, and the subsequent implementation agreements concluded by the two sides,

text: Recalling further all relevant international law, including humanitarian and human rights law, and, in particular, the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, the Convention on the Rights of the Child and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling further* all relevant international law, including humanitarian and human rights law, and, in particular, the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, the Convention on the Rights of the Child and the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women,

text: Gravely concerned at the difficult living conditions and humanitarian situation affecting the Palestinian people, in particular women and children, throughout the occupied Palestinian territory, particularly in the Gaza Strip where economic recovery and vast infrastructure repair, rehabilitation and development are urgently needed, especially in the aftermath of the conflict of July and August 2014,
textWithHighlights: *Gravely concerned* at the difficult living conditions and humanitarian situation affecting the Palestinian people, in particular women and children, throughout the occupied Palestinian territory, particularly in the Gaza Strip where economic recovery and vast infrastructure repair, rehabilitation and development are urgently needed, especially in the aftermath of the conflict of July and August 2014,

text: Conscious of the urgent need for improvement in the economic and social infrastructure of the occupied territory,
textWithHighlights: Conscious of the urgent need for improvement in the economic and social infrastructure of the occupied territory,
uncertainties: Preambular clause with no operative verb. The phrase "Conscious of" signals context but is not in the provided exhaustive list of operative verbs, so no verb/assignees/deliverables extracted.

text: Welcoming, in this context, the development of projects, notably on infrastructure, to revive the Palestinian economy and improve the living conditions of the Palestinian people, stressing the need to create the appropriate conditions to facilitate the implementation of these projects, and noting the contribution of partners in the region and of the international community,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming*, in this context, the development of projects, notably on infrastructure, to revive the Palestinian economy and improve the living conditions of the Palestinian people, *stressing* the need to create the appropriate conditions to facilitate the implementation of these projects, and *noting* the contribution of partners in the region and of the {{international community}},
uncertainties: "partners in the region" is vague and not mapped to a specific entity; only "international community" is captured as a mentioned entity.

text: Aware that development is difficult under occupation and is best promoted in circumstances of peace and stability,
textWithHighlights: Aware that development is difficult under occupation and is best promoted in circumstances of peace and stability,

text: Noting the great economic and social challenges facing the Palestinian people and their leadership,
textWithHighlights: *Noting* the great economic and social challenges facing the Palestinian people and their leadership,

text: Emphasizing the importance of the safety and well-being of all people, in particular women and children, in the whole Middle East region, the promotion of which is facilitated, inter alia, in a stable and secure environment,
textWithHighlights: *Emphasizing* the importance of the safety and well-being of all people, in particular women and children, in the whole Middle East region, the promotion of which is facilitated, inter alia, in a stable and secure environment,

text: Deeply concerned about the negative impact, including the health and psychological consequences, of violence on the present and future well-being of children in the region,
textWithHighlights: *Deeply concerned* about the negative impact, including the health and psychological consequences, of violence on the present and future well-being of children in the region,

text: Conscious of the urgent necessity for international assistance to the Palestinian people, taking into account the Palestinian priorities, and recalling in this regard the National Early Recovery and Reconstruction Plan for Gaza,
textWithHighlights: *Conscious of* the urgent necessity for international assistance to the Palestinian people, taking into account the Palestinian priorities, and *recalling* in this regard the National Early Recovery and Reconstruction Plan for Gaza,
uncertainties: "Conscious of" is treated as an observing preambular verb and normalized to "bear in mind". The phrase "taking into account" was not annotated as a separate operative verb; it could be interpreted as akin to "consider" but is treated here as part of the same preambular context.

text: Expressing grave concern about the grave humanitarian situation in the Gaza Strip, and underlining the importance of emergency and humanitarian assistance and the need for the advancement of reconstruction in the Gaza Strip,
textWithHighlights: Expressing grave concern about the grave humanitarian situation in the Gaza Strip, and underlining the importance of emergency and humanitarian assistance and the need for the advancement of reconstruction in the Gaza Strip,
uncertainties: Preambular paragraph; no operative verbs, assignees, or deliverables.

text: Welcoming the results of the Conference to Support Middle East Peace, convened in Washington, D.C., on 1 October 1993, the establishment of the Ad Hoc Liaison Committee for the Coordination of the International Assistance to Palestinians and the work being done by the World Bank as its secretariat and the establishment of the Consultative Group, as well as all follow-up meetings and international mechanisms established to provide assistance to the Palestinian people,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the results of the Conference to Support Middle East Peace, convened in Washington, D.C., on 1 October 1993, the establishment of the {{Ad Hoc Liaison Committee}} for the Coordination of the International Assistance to Palestinians and the work being done by the {{World Bank}} as its secretariat and the establishment of the Consultative Group, as well as all follow-up meetings and international mechanisms established to provide assistance to the Palestinian people,
uncertainties: Did not mark "Consultative Group" as a mentioned entity due to ambiguity about its formal designation in this context.

text: Underlining the importance of the Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza, held on 12 October 2014, and urging the timely and full disbursement of pledges for expediting the provision of humanitarian assistance and the reconstruction process,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Disbursement of pledges

textWithHighlights: *Underlining* the importance of the {{Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza}}, held on 12 October 2014, and *urging* the timely and full [[disbursement of pledges]] for expediting the provision of humanitarian assistance and the reconstruction process,
uncertainties: This is a preambular paragraph; assignee for 'urging' is not specified (likely donors/Member States). Considered only 'disbursement of pledges' as a deliverable; treating 'provision of humanitarian assistance' and 'reconstruction process' as contextual aims rather than direct deliverables.

text: Recalling the International Donors’ Conference for the Palestinian State, held in Paris on 17 December 2007, the Berlin Conference in Support of Palestinian Civil Security and the Rule of Law, held on 24 June 2008, and the Palestine Investment Conferences, held in Bethlehem from 21 to 23 May 2008 and on 2 and 3 June 2010, and the International Conference in Support of the Palestinian Economy for the Reconstruction of Gaza, held in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt, on 2 March 2009,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* the International Donors’ Conference for the Palestinian State, held in Paris on 17 December 2007, the Berlin Conference in Support of Palestinian Civil Security and the Rule of Law, held on 24 June 2008, and the Palestine Investment Conferences, held in Bethlehem from 21 to 23 May 2008 and on 2 and 3 June 2010, and the International Conference in Support of the Palestinian Economy for the Reconstruction of Gaza, held in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt, on 2 March 2009,

text: Welcoming the ministerial meetings of the Conference on Cooperation among East Asian Countries for Palestinian Development, convened in Tokyo in February 2013 and in Jakarta in March 2014, as a forum to mobilize political and economic assistance, including through exchanges of expertise and lessons learned, in support of Palestinian development,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Conference on Cooperation among East Asian Countries for Palestinian Development
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Conference on Cooperation among East Asian Countries for Palestinian Development

textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* the ministerial meetings of the {{Conference on Cooperation among East Asian Countries for Palestinian Development}}, convened in Tokyo in February 2013 and in Jakarta in March 2014, as a forum to mobilize political and economic assistance, including through exchanges of expertise and lessons learned, in support of Palestinian development,

text: Welcoming also the latest meetings of the Ad Hoc Liaison Committee for the Coordination of the International Assistance to Palestinians, held in New York on 25 September 2013 and 22 September 2014, in Brussels on 27 May 2015, in New York on 30 September 2015, 19 September 2016, 18 September 2017, 27 September 2018, 26 September 2019, via videoconference on 2 June 2020 and on 23 February 2021, in Oslo on 17 November 2021, in Brussels on 10 May 2022, in New York on 22 September 2022, in Brussels on 3 and 4 May 2023 and in New York on 20 September 2023 and 26 September 2024,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Ad Hoc Liaison Committee for the Coordination of the International Assistance to Palestinians

textWithHighlights: *Welcoming also* the latest meetings of the {{Ad Hoc Liaison Committee for the Coordination of the International Assistance to Palestinians}}, held in New York on 25 September 2013 and 22 September 2014, in Brussels on 27 May 2015, in New York on 30 September 2015, 19 September 2016, 18 September 2017, 27 September 2018, 26 September 2019, via videoconference on 2 June 2020 and on 23 February 2021, in Oslo on 17 November 2021, in Brussels on 10 May 2022, in New York on 22 September 2022, in Brussels on 3 and 4 May 2023 and in New York on 20 September 2023 and 26 September 2024,

text: Welcoming further the activities of the Joint Liaison Committee, which provides a forum in which economic policy and practical matters related to donor assistance are discussed with the Palestinian Authority,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming further* the activities of the {{Joint Liaison Committee}}, which provides a forum in which economic policy and practical matters related to donor assistance are discussed with the {{Palestinian Authority}},
uncertainties: Possibility of confusion between the "Joint Liaison Committee" mentioned here and the "Ad Hoc Liaison Committee" referenced in preceding paragraphs; treated here as distinct entities.

text: Welcoming the implementation of the Palestinian National Development Plan 2011–2013 on governance, economy, social development and infrastructure and the adoption of the Palestinian National Development Plan 2014–2016: State-building to Sovereignty, and stressing the need for continued international support for the Palestinian State-building process, as outlined in the summary by the Chair of the meeting of the Ad Hoc Liaison Committee held on 22 September 2014,
textWithHighlights:
*Welcoming* the implementation of the Palestinian National Development Plan 2011–2013 on governance, economy, social development and infrastructure and the adoption of the Palestinian National Development Plan 2014–2016: State-building to Sovereignty, and *stressing* the need for continued international support for the Palestinian State-building process, as outlined in the summary by the Chair of the meeting of the {{Ad Hoc Liaison Committee}} held on 22
September 2014,

text: Stressing the need for the full engagement of the United Nations in the process of building Palestinian institutions and in providing broad assistance to the Palestinian people,
textWithHighlights: *Stressing* the need for the full engagement of the {{United Nations}} in the process of building Palestinian institutions and in providing broad assistance to the Palestinian people,

text: Recognizing, in this regard, the positive contribution of the United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2014–2016, which is aimed, inter alia, at enhancing developmental support and assistance to the Palestinian people and strengthening institutional capacity in line with Palestinian national priorities,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing*, in this regard, the positive contribution of the United Nations Development Assistance Framework 2014–2016, which is aimed, inter alia, at enhancing developmental support and assistance to the Palestinian people and strengthening institutional capacity in line with Palestinian national priorities,
uncertainties: Considered marking 'United Nations' as a mentioned entity, but it appears as part of the framework name rather than as an organizational reference; therefore not highlighted.

text: Welcoming steps to ease the restrictions on movement and access in the West Bank, while stressing the need for further steps to be taken in this regard, and recognizing that such steps would improve living conditions and the situation on the ground and could promote further Palestinian economic development,
textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* steps to ease the restrictions on movement and access in the West Bank, while *stressing* the need for further steps to be taken in this regard, and *recognizing* that such steps would improve living conditions and the situation on the ground and could promote further Palestinian economic development,

text: Welcoming also the tripartite agreement facilitated by the United Nations regarding access to the Gaza Strip, and calling for its full implementation and complementary measures that address the need for a fundamental change in policy that allows for the sustained and regular opening of the border crossings for the movement of persons and goods, including for humanitarian and commercial flows and for the reconstruction and economic recovery of Gaza,

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Full implementation of tripartite agreement on Gaza access
Sustained and regular opening of border crossings for movement of persons and goods
deliverables.deliverable: sustained and regular opening of the border crossings

textWithHighlights: *Welcoming* also the tripartite agreement facilitated by the {{United Nations}} regarding access to the Gaza Strip, and *calling for* its [[full implementation]] and complementary measures that address the need for a fundamental change in policy that allows for the [[sustained and regular opening of the border crossings]] for the movement of persons and goods, including for humanitarian and commercial flows and for the reconstruction and economic recovery of Gaza,
uncertainties: Classified “full implementation” and “opening of the border crossings” under the deliverable type “policy”; these are operational/policy actions rather than documents, but the taxonomy lacks an explicit “implementation” category.

text: Stressing that the situation in the Gaza Strip is unsustainable and that a durable ceasefire agreement must lead to a fundamental improvement in the living conditions of the Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip and ensure the safety and well-being of civilians on both sides,
textWithHighlights: *Stressing* that the situation in the Gaza Strip is unsustainable and that a durable ceasefire agreement must lead to a fundamental improvement in the living conditions of the Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip and ensure the safety and well-being of civilians on both sides,

text: Stressing also the urgency of reaching a durable solution to the crisis in Gaza through the full implementation of Security Council resolution 1860 (2009) of 8 January 2009, including by preventing the illicit trafficking in arms and ammunition and by ensuring the sustained reopening of the crossing points on the basis of existing agreements, including the 2005 Agreement on Movement and Access between the Palestinian Authority and Israel,
textWithHighlights: *Stressing also* the urgency of reaching a durable solution to the crisis in Gaza through the full implementation of {{Security Council}} resolution 1860 (2009) of 8 January 2009, including by preventing the illicit trafficking in arms and ammunition and by ensuring the sustained reopening of the crossing points on the basis of existing agreements, including the 2005 Agreement on Movement and Access between the {{Palestinian Authority}} and {{Israel}},

text: Stressing, in this regard, the importance of the effective exercise by the Palestinian Authority of its full government responsibilities in the Gaza Strip in all fields, including through its presence at the Gaza crossing points,
textWithHighlights: *Stressing*, in this regard, the importance of the effective exercise by the {{Palestinian Authority}} of its full government responsibilities in the Gaza Strip in all fields, including through its presence at the Gaza crossing points,

text: Noting the active participation of the United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process and Personal Representative of the Secretary-General to the Palestine Liberation Organization and the Palestinian Authority in the activities of the Special Envoys of the Quartet,

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process

textWithHighlights: *Noting* the active participation of the {{United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process}} and Personal Representative of the {{Secretary-General}} to the {{Palestine Liberation Organization}} and the {{Palestinian Authority}} in the activities of the {{Special Envoys of the Quartet}},

text: Reaffirming the necessity of achieving a comprehensive resolution of the Arab-Israeli conflict in all its aspects, on the basis of relevant Security Council resolutions, including resolutions 242 (1967) of 22 November 1967, 338 (1973) of 22 October 1973, 1397 (2002) of 12 March 2002, 1515 (2003) of 19 November 2003, 1850 (2008) of 16 December 2008 and 1860 (2009), as well as the terms of reference of the Madrid Conference and the principle of land for peace, in order to ensure a political solution, with two States – Israel and an independent, democratic, contiguous, sovereign and viable Palestinian State – living side by side in peace and security and mutual recognition,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* the necessity of achieving a comprehensive resolution of the Arab-Israeli conflict in all its aspects, on the basis of relevant {{Security Council}} resolutions, including resolutions 242 (1967) of 22 November 1967, 338 (1973) of 22 October 1973, 1397 (2002) of 12 March 2002, 1515 (2003) of 19 November 2003, 1850 (2008) of 16 December 2008 and 1860 (2009), as well as the terms of reference of the {{Madrid Conference}} and the principle of land for peace, in order to ensure a political solution, with two States – {{Israel}} and an independent, democratic, contiguous, sovereign and viable {{Palestinian State}} – living side by side in peace and security and mutual recognition,
uncertainties: Mapped 'Palestinian State' to ISO code PS (State of Palestine) though the text uses an aspirational phrasing; included 'Madrid Conference' as an 'other' mentioned entity since it is not in the predefined list.

text: Having considered the report of the Secretary-General,
textWithHighlights: *Having considered* the report of the {{Secretary-General}},

text: Expressing grave concern about continuing violence against civilians,
textWithHighlights: *Expressing grave concern* about continuing violence against civilians,

text: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General;
textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the report of the {{Secretary-General}};

text: Expresses its appreciation to the Secretary-General for his rapid response and ongoing efforts regarding assistance to the Palestinian people, including with regard to the emergency humanitarian needs in the Gaza Strip;
textWithHighlights: *Expresses its appreciation* to the {{Secretary-General}} for his rapid response and ongoing efforts regarding assistance to the Palestinian people, including with regard to the emergency humanitarian needs in the Gaza Strip;

text: Also expresses its appreciation to the Member States, United Nations bodies and intergovernmental, regional and non‑governmental organizations that have provided and continue to provide assistance to the Palestinian people;
textWithHighlights: Also *expresses its appreciation* to the {{Member States}}, {{United Nations bodies}} and {{intergovernmental}}, {{regional}} and {{non‑governmental organizations}} that have provided and continue to provide assistance to the Palestinian people;
uncertainties: "United Nations bodies" could refer to UN organs or the broader UN system; normalized here to UN System.

text: Stresses the importance of the work of the United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process and Personal Representative of the Secretary-General to the Palestine Liberation Organization and the Palestinian Authority and of the steps taken under the auspices of the Secretary-General to ensure the achievement of a coordinated mechanism for United Nations activities throughout the occupied territories;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process

textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the importance of the work of the {{United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process}} and Personal Representative of the {{Secretary-General}} to the {{Palestine Liberation Organization}} and the {{Palestinian Authority}} and of the steps taken under the auspices of the {{Secretary-General}} to ensure the achievement of a coordinated mechanism for {{United Nations}} activities throughout the occupied territories;

text: Urges Member States, international financial institutions of the United Nations system, intergovernmental and non‑governmental organizations and regional and interregional organizations to extend, as rapidly and as generously as possible, economic and social assistance to the Palestinian people, in close cooperation with the Palestine Liberation Organization and through official Palestinian institutions;

assignees.assignee: international financial institutions of the United Nations system

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: economic and social assistance for the Palestinian people

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>>, <<international financial institutions of the United Nations system>>, <<intergovernmental and non‑governmental organizations>> and <<regional and interregional organizations>> to extend, as rapidly and as generously as possible, [[economic and social assistance]] to the Palestinian people, in close cooperation with the {{Palestine Liberation Organization}} and through {{official Palestinian institutions}};
uncertainties: Classifying “economic and social assistance” under a single deliverable type is somewhat ambiguous; it could involve financial resources, technical support, and/or humanitarian assistance. Chosen category: financial_resources.

text: Welcomes the meetings of the Ad Hoc Liaison Committee for the Coordination of the International Assistance to Palestinians of 25 September 2013, 22 September 2014, 27 May and 30 September 2015, 19 September 2016, 18 September 2017, 27 September 2018, 26 September 2019, 2 June 2020, 23 February and 17 November 2021, 10 May and 22 September 2022, 3 and 4 May and 20 September 2023 and 26 September 2024 and the outcome of the Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza, held on 12 October 2014, and the generous donor response to support the needs of the Palestinian people, and urges the rapid disbursement of donor pledges;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Ad Hoc Liaison Committee for the Coordination of the International Assistance to Palestinians

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza
mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Disbursement of donor pledges

textWithHighlights: *Welcomes* the meetings of the {{Ad Hoc Liaison Committee for the Coordination of the International Assistance to Palestinians}} of 25 September 2013, 22 September 2014, 27 May and 30 September 2015, 19 September 2016, 18 September 2017, 27 September 2018, 26 September 2019, 2 June 2020, 23 February and 17 November 2021, 10 May and 22 September 2022, 3 and 4 May and 20 September 2023 and 26 September 2024 and the outcome of the {{Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza}}, held on 12 October 2014, and the generous donor response to support the needs of the Palestinian people, and *urges* the [[rapid disbursement of donor pledges]];
uncertainties: The assignee for the urging is not explicitly stated; it likely targets donors, but the text does not specify, so no assignee is recorded.

text: Stresses the importance of following up on the results of the Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza to effectively promote economic recovery and reconstruction in a timely and sustainable manner;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the importance of following up on the results of the Cairo International Conference on Palestine: Reconstructing Gaza to effectively promote economic recovery and reconstruction in a timely and sustainable manner;

text: Calls upon donors that have not yet converted their budget support pledges into disbursements to transfer funds as soon as possible, encourages all donors to increase their direct assistance to the Palestinian Authority in accordance with its government programme in order to enable it to build a viable and prosperous Palestinian State, underlines the need for equitable burden-sharing by donors in this effort, and encourages donors to consider aligning funding cycles with the Palestinian Authority’s national budget cycle;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: transfer funds
increase direct assistance to the Palestinian Authority
align funding cycles with Palestinian Authority budget cycle

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<donors>> that have not yet converted their budget support pledges into disbursements to [[transfer funds]] as soon as possible, *encourages* all <<donors>> to [[increase their direct assistance]] to the {{Palestinian Authority}} in accordance with its government programme in order to enable it to build a viable and prosperous Palestinian State, *underlines* the need for equitable burden-sharing by {{donors}} in this effort, and *encourages* <<donors>> to consider [[aligning funding cycles]] with the {{Palestinian Authority}}’s national budget cycle;
uncertainties: Assignee 'donors' is not a standard category in the entity list; treated as 'other'. The deliverable type for 'aligning funding cycles' is classified as 'policy' (could also be seen as a financing/administrative measure).

text: Calls upon relevant organizations and agencies of the United Nations system to intensify their assistance in response to the urgent needs of the Palestinian people in accordance with priorities set forth by the Palestinian side;

assignees.assignee: organizations and agencies of the United Nations system

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Assistance to Palestinian people

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<relevant organizations and agencies of the United Nations system>> to intensify their [[assistance]] in response to the urgent needs of the Palestinian people in accordance with priorities set forth by the Palestinian side;
uncertainties: Deliverable type inferred as humanitarian_assistance based on the phrase "urgent needs of the Palestinian people"; the text does not explicitly specify the type of assistance.

text: Expresses its appreciation for the work of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East, and recognizes the vital role of the Agency in providing humanitarian assistance to the Palestinian people, particularly in the Gaza Strip;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East
United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East

textWithHighlights: *Expresses its appreciation* for the work of the {{United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East}}, and *recognizes* the vital role of the {{Agency}} in providing humanitarian assistance to the Palestinian people, particularly in the Gaza Strip;

text: Calls upon the international community to provide urgently needed assistance and services in an effort to alleviate the difficult humanitarian situation being faced by Palestinian women, children and their families and to help in the reconstruction and development of relevant Palestinian institutions;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: humanitarian assistance
reconstruction and development of Palestinian institutions

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* the <<international community>> to provide urgently needed [[assistance and services]] in an effort to alleviate the difficult humanitarian situation being faced by Palestinian women, children and their families and to help in the [[reconstruction and development]] of relevant Palestinian institutions;
uncertainties: Classifying "assistance and services" as humanitarian_assistance is inferred from the context; "reconstruction and development of institutions" is mapped to capacity_building though it could overlap with infrastructure depending on the nature of the reconstruction.

text: Stresses the role that all funding instruments, including the European Commission’s Palestinian-European Mechanism for the Management of Socioeconomic Aid and the World Bank trust fund, have been playing in directly assisting the Palestinian people;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: European Commission’s Palestinian-European Mechanism for the Management of Socioeconomic Aid

textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the role that all funding instruments, including the {{European Commission’s Palestinian-European Mechanism for the Management of Socioeconomic Aid}} and the {{World Bank}} trust fund, have been playing in directly assisting the Palestinian people;
uncertainties: Normalized name for the European Commission mechanism is given as PEGASE (common abbreviation), though the full name is used in the text.

text: Urges Member States to open their markets to exports of Palestinian products on the most favourable terms, consistent with appropriate trading rules, and to implement fully existing trade and cooperation agreements;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Open markets to Palestinian exports
Implement existing trade and cooperation agreements
deliverables.deliverable: implement fully existing trade and cooperation agreements

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>> to [[open their markets]] to exports of Palestinian products on the most favourable terms, consistent with appropriate trading rules, and to [[implement fully existing trade and cooperation agreements]];

text: Calls upon the international donor community to expedite the delivery of pledged assistance to the Palestinian people to meet their urgent needs;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Delivery of pledged assistance to the Palestinian people

textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* the <<international donor community>> to expedite the [[delivery of pledged assistance]] to the Palestinian people to meet their urgent needs;
uncertainties: The nature of the pledged assistance is not specified; categorized as humanitarian_assistance given context, but it could also include financial_resources.

text: Stresses, in this context, the importance of ensuring free humanitarian access to the Palestinian people and the free movement of persons and goods;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses*, in this context, the importance of ensuring free humanitarian access to the Palestinian people and the free movement of persons and goods;

text: Also stresses the need for the full implementation by both parties of existing agreements, including the Agreement on Movement and Access and the Agreed Principles for the Rafah Crossing, of 15 November 2005, to allow for the freedom of movement of the Palestinian civilian population, as well as for imports and exports, within and into and out of the Gaza Strip;
textWithHighlights: Also *stresses* the need for the full implementation by both parties of existing agreements, including the Agreement on Movement and Access and the Agreed Principles for the Rafah Crossing, of 15 November 2005, to allow for the freedom of movement of the Palestinian civilian population, as well as for imports and exports, within and into and out of the Gaza Strip;

text: Further stresses the need to ensure the safety and security of humanitarian personnel, premises, facilities, equipment, vehicles and supplies, as well as the need to ensure safe and unhindered access by humanitarian personnel and delivery of supplies and equipment, in order to allow such personnel to efficiently perform their task of assisting affected civilian populations;
textWithHighlights: *Further stresses* the need to ensure the safety and security of humanitarian personnel, premises, facilities, equipment, vehicles and supplies, as well as the need to ensure safe and unhindered access by humanitarian personnel and delivery of supplies and equipment, in order to allow such personnel to efficiently perform their task of assisting affected civilian populations;
uncertainties: No explicit assignee or concrete deliverable is specified; the paragraph reinforces the importance of ensuring safety and access rather than directing a specific actor to take action.

text: Urges the international donor community, United Nations agencies and organizations and non‑governmental organizations to extend to the Palestinian people, as rapidly as possible, emergency economic assistance and humanitarian assistance, particularly in the Gaza Strip, to counter the impact of the current crisis;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: emergency economic assistance
humanitarian assistance

textWithHighlights: *Urges* the <<international donor community>>, <<United Nations agencies and organizations>> and <<non‑governmental organizations>> to extend to the Palestinian people, as rapidly as possible, [[emergency economic assistance]] and [[humanitarian assistance]], particularly in the Gaza Strip, to counter the impact of the current crisis;
uncertainties: Mapped “United Nations agencies and organizations” to the normalized entity “UN System”; alternatively, this could be narrowed to “UN agencies.”

text: Stresses the need for the continued implementation of the Paris Protocol on Economic Relations of 29 April 1994, fifth annex to the Israeli-Palestinian Interim Agreement on the West Bank and the Gaza Strip, signed in Washington, D.C., on 28 September 1995, including with regard to the full, prompt and regular transfer of Palestinian indirect tax revenues;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the need for the continued implementation of the Paris Protocol on Economic Relations of 29 April 1994, fifth annex to the Israeli-Palestinian Interim Agreement on the West Bank and the Gaza Strip, signed in Washington, D.C., on 28 September 1995, including with regard to the full, prompt and regular transfer of Palestinian indirect tax revenues;

text: Requests the Secretary-General to submit a report to the General Assembly at its eightieth session, through the Economic and Social Council, on the implementation of the present resolution, containing:

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Report on implementation of the present resolution

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to submit a [[report]] to the {{General Assembly}} at its eightieth session, through the {{Economic and Social Council}}, on the implementation of the present resolution, containing:

text: An assessment of the assistance actually received by the Palestinian people;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Assessment of assistance received by the Palestinian people

textWithHighlights: An [[assessment]] of the assistance actually received by the Palestinian people;

text: An assessment of the needs still unmet and specific proposals for responding effectively to them;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Assessment of unmet needs
Specific proposals to respond to unmet needs

textWithHighlights: An [[assessment]] of the needs still unmet and [[specific proposals]] for responding effectively to them;

text: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session, under the item entitled “Strengthening of the coordination of humanitarian and disaster relief assistance of the United Nations, including special economic assistance”, the sub-item entitled “Assistance to the Palestinian people”.

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Include sub-item “Assistance to the Palestinian people” in GA 80th session agenda

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session, under the item entitled “Strengthening of the coordination of humanitarian and disaster relief assistance of the {{United Nations}}, including special economic assistance”, the [[sub-item]] entitled “Assistance to the Palestinian people”.

text: 50th plenary meeting
9 December 2024
